intro: Psychotria rosulata, commonly known as the "rosy psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Psychotria rosulata is also notable for its use in traditional medicine and its role in ecological interactions within its native habitat.
